summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2019 between defense attorney Michael Bachner and federal prosecutors (including Maurene Comey) regarding scheduling a meeting (a 'reverse proffer') for a client in the Epstein investigation. The emails discuss the client's intent to invoke the Fifth Amendment before a grand jury and include attachments of the Epstein non-prosecution agreement and a proffer agreement.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing a client in the Epstein investigation, communicating with prosecutors to schedule a meeting and stating the client will invoke the Fifth Amendment before the grand jury.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Federal prosecutor with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, corresponding with defense attorney Michael Bachner regarding scheduling and case materials.

connections.description: Attorney-client communication regarding a client in the Epstein investigation, discussing scheduling a reverse proffer and grand jury testimony.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: A client of Michael Bachner was subpoenaed to testify before a grand jury on this date; Bachner notified prosecutors the client would invoke the Fifth Amendment.

events.title: Proposed Reverse Proffer Meeting
events.description: A reverse proffer meeting was proposed to take place at the prosecutors' office at 1 St. Andrews Plaza to discuss the client's position in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Client Arrest in Queens
events.description: Michael Bachner notified prosecutors that another client was arrested and was being arraigned in Queens County on a state charge, affecting scheduling.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY (prosecutors' office)
39 Broadway, Suite 1610, New York, NY (Bachner & Associates office)
keyFacts: A client of attorney Michael Bachner was subpoenaed to testify before a grand jury on July 24, 2019, in the Epstein investigation and intended to invoke the Fifth Amendment.
Prosecutors provided Michael Bachner with the Epstein non-prosecution agreement (NPA) from 2007 and a blank proffer agreement as part of their discussions.
The emails center on scheduling a 'reverse proffer' meeting between the defense and prosecution to discuss the client's position.
The correspondence reveals ongoing federal investigative activity in the Epstein case in July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest.
The document shows communication between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and defense counsel regarding a witness in the investigation.
